newsitem.title: PERU: Lima shares end up led by buys in mining sector.
newsitem.headline: Lima shares end up led by buys in mining sector.

text.p: Shares on the Lima stock exchange closed up Monday led by gains in the mining sector, which continued to attract investors due to elevated international prices, brokers said.
The market was likley to follow the same trend Tuesday, they added.
Monday, the General Index rose 0.74 percent to 1,726.15 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index climbed 0.43 percent to 2,487.39 points.
In a total of 1,790 trades, volume was a 32.0 million soles ($12.1 million), according to preliminary figures.
Benchmark Telefonica del Peru underperformed the market, closing down 0.16 percent to 6.31 soles in modest volume of 710,000 shares.
Brokers said they expected the benchmark's small dip to be reversed Tuesday as investors were confident the company had solid growth prospects.
